intro: Zerna ornans, commonly known as the golden tawny grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and golden-yellow inflorescence. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its slender, wiry stems and narrow leaves are adapted to arid conditions, allowing it to thrive in dry environments. Zerna ornans is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
